question: 襲う
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>attack</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to attack</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: "You going <vocabulary>to attack</vocabulary> me or something? <reading>Oh so</reading> scary you are. Oh so scary. Ho ho ho."
